entry.title: Entry #76 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: Before the Court is Plaintiffs' Unopposed Motion for Withdrawal and Substitution of Local Counsel. ECF No. 74 . The Motion is GRANTED. Added attorney Noah M. Schottenstein for X Corp. Noah M. Schottenstein for X.AI LLC. Attorney Robert Rowe; Monica Gaudioso and Alex More terminated. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 12/1/2025) (saw) (Entered: 12/01/2025)

entry.title: Entry #75 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER GRANTING MOTION FOR ISSUANCE OF LETTER OF REQUEST FOR INTERNATIONAL JUDICIAL ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE HAGUE CONVENTION ON THE TAKING OF EVIDENCE ABROAD IN CIVIL OR COMMERCIAL MATTERS 72 : Upon consideration of Plaintiffs' Motion for Issuance of Letter of Request for International Judicial Assistance Pursuant to the Hague Convention on the Taking of Evidence Abroad in Civil or Commercial Matters, the Motion is hereby GRANTED and the Court APPROVES the proposed Letter of Request included with the Motion. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 11/26/2025) (wxc) (Entered: 11/26/2025)

entry.title: Entry #70 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: Before the Court is Defendants' Unopposed Motion to Extend Deadline to Answer Plaintiffs' Complaint. ECF No. 69 . The Motion is hereby GRANTED. The deadline to answer is extended to December 11, 2025. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 11/18/2025) (saw) (Entered: 11/18/2025)

entry.title: Entry #68 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: Before the Court are Defendant Apple Inc.'s Motion to Dismiss, ECF No. 36, and the Motion of Defendants OpenAI, Inc., OpenAI, LLC, and OpenAI OPCO, LLC to Dismiss the Complaint Pursuant to Rule 12(B)(6), ECF No. 40 . The Motions are hereby DENIED. This Order should not be construed as a judgment (or pre-judgment) on the merits of this litigation. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 11/13/2025) (saw) (Entered: 11/13/2025)

entry.title: Entry #62 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: Before the Court is the issue concerning whether the Fort Worth Division of the Northern District of Texas is the proper venue in this case. Having considered the relevant docket entries and applicable law, the Court has determined that transfer of venue is inappropriate. (see order for specifics) (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 10/16/2025) (bdb) (Main Document 62 replaced on 10/17/2025) (bdb). (Entered: 10/16/2025)

entry.title: Entry #61 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: SCHEDULING ORDER: This case is set for trial on this Court's four - week docket beginning October 19, 2026. Joinder of Parties due by 12/15/2025. Amended Pleadings due by 12/15/2025. Deadline for mediation is on or before 4/22/2026. Discovery due by 5/22/2026. Motions due by 6/22/2026. Pretrial Order due by 9/24/2026. The court appoints David Lattimore Evans as mediator. Alternative Dispute Resolution Summary form provided electronically or by US Mail as appropriate. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 10/16/2025) (mmw) (Entered: 10/16/2025)

entry.title: Entry #56 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ELECTRONIC ORDER denying 53 Application for Admission Pro Hac Vice of Kevin S. Schwartz. Mr. Schwartz has been granted admission pro hac vice on at least two prior occasions in the Northern District of Texas. Mr. Schwartz is ordered to seek admission in the Northern District of Texas by 10/22/2025. Clerk shall return admission fee to Applicant. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 10/15/2025)(chmb) (Entered: 10/15/2025)

entry.title: Entry #55 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: AMENDED ELECTRONIC ORDER denying 52 Application for Admission Pro Hac Vice of William Savitt. Mr. Savitt has been granted admission pro hac vice on at least two other occasions in the Northern District of Texas. Mr. Savitt is ordered to seek admission in the Northern District of Texas by 10/22/2025. Clerk shall return admission fee to applicant. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 10/15/2025)(chmb)Modified on 10/15/2025 (chmb). (Entered: 10/15/2025)

entry.title: Entry #54 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ELECTRONIC ORDER granting 51 Application for Admission Pro Hac Vice of Stephen D. Levandoski. Important Reminder: Unless excused for cause, an attorney who is not an ECF user must register within 14 days of the date the attorney appears in a case pursuant to LR 5.1(f) and LCrR 49.2(g). (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 10/15/2025)(chmb) (Entered: 10/15/2025)
